alert.note: Alert for Fluvanna (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:59PM EST until January 11 at 4:53AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Locks affecting Henrico and City of Richmond County. James River At Cartersville affecting Powhatan, Cumberland and Goochland Counties. Rivanna River At Palmyra affecting Fluvanna County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Westham affecting Henrico, City of Richmond and Chesterfield Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Cartersville, Richmond Westham...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Rivanna River at Palmyra. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, River out of banks in Palmyra. Some streets closed in town as well as secondary roads leading into town. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:50 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 18.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:50 PM EST Wednesday was 23.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 9.2 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.3 feet on 02/24/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM EST.
